titleStmt.title: A holy commonwealth, or Political aphorisms, opening the true principles of government: for the healing of the mistakes, and resolving the doubts, that most endanger and trouble England at this time: (if yet there may be hope.) And directing the desires of sober Christians that long to see the kingdoms of this world, become the kingdoms of the Lord, and of his Christ. / Written by Richard Baxter at the invitation of James Harrington Esquire. With a preface to them that have caused our eclipses since 1646. And a sounder answer to the healing question. And the Jesuites method for restoring popery.
titleStmt.author: Baxter, Richard, 1615-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Thomas Underhill and Francis Tyton, and are to be sold at the sign of the Anchor and Bible in Pauls Churchyard, and at the Three Daggers in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: In this edition the title page is A2; "To all those in the Army" begins on A3. The title page is in the same setting as the other edition except for the imprint. This edition is probably the later of the two as there is no errata leaf.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
